title: Gijon boss Fernandez resigns but refuses £3.5 payout
text:
Fernandez led Sporting to promotion to La Liga in his first full season and helped them avoid relegation on the final day of last season Abelardo Fernandez has left his role as Sporting Gijon head coach, but refused a reported four million euros (£3.5m) in compensation. 
Gijon are 18th in La Liga, after losing seven of their last eight league games. 
Fernandez, 46, a Gijon native, played for the club for five years and took over as head coach in 2014. 
"I don't have a problem writing off the money, "said Fernandez. "There are more important things - loyalty to my club above all." 
The ex-Spain and Barcelona defender will be replaced by former Girona, Valladolid and Levante coach Rubi. Share this page
